commitResults.messageBody:
Used java.util.Scanner to read inputs from terminal, and obtained user String input with .nextLine().

Checked whether the input equals 'bye'. If false, stay in the loop and prompt user input again. If true, exit the loop and print exit message.

Created two different functions outside of main.

Modified previous method Echo from a while loop to a do-while loop, since first iteration does not check for userInput.

AddAndList has a array of size 100 that for each user input (excluding keywords bye and list), saves the user input into the array.

Added keyword 'list' which functions to list out all the user input saved within the array, during the runtime of the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task Class and Mark Task as Done
commitResults.messageBody:
Created a new class called Task that contains three parameters, task description, task index, and boolean isDone

Within class Task, theres is a constructor, get status icon (determines whether task is done), and class method mark as done.

Function checks whether user input has keywords (bye, list, done). Logic for loop exit is unchanged, and for listing of array unchanged.

Added 'done' function which allows user to select which list element to be marked, calling the markAsDone function to update the isDone boolean state of the specific Task object.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add class-level Member taskCount and methods listTask, addTask and markTask
commitResults.messageBody:
Changed the taskCount into a class-level member such that objects in class can access this variable.

Refactored by extracting method to form the three new methods. Renamed all methods such that it follows the camelCase standards.

Added support for tracking three different types of tasks (Todo, Events, Deadlines). Each of these three task types are subclasses under class Task.

For Todo, changed previous method to add tasks, used split by regex space to separate the description from the command (todo).

Similarly, for Deadline and Event, used split to separate the specific description such as deadline and used String.format to format the output.
Add logic to catch array out of bound errors by seeing if number of array items after split by spaces < 2. If so, throw DukeException error.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add deleteTask and Java collections class ArrayList of type Task
commitResults.messageBody:
To support deletion of tasks, made use of ArrayList methods .remove().

Edited addTask function to support use of ArrayList collection .add() and changed tasks (task list) to type ArrayList<Task>.
Add extra error handler for incorrect placeholder (/at and /by) for event and deadlines respectively

commitResults.messageTitle: Add imports to prepare for File IO
Add changes to catch error function
